Class ViewDeckIconJPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • ViewDeckIconJPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class ViewDeckIconJPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Author:
    Trinh Nguyen
    Description: Paints a 100x100 JPanel that graphically shows the size of the deck. It also shows small representation of each color in the order that the ModelFlashCard are stored in ModelFlashCardDeck.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • setDeckTitle

        public void setDeckTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets deck title string in the top of this panel when painted.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Parameters:
        title - The title that _deckTitle should be set to.

      • setSelected

        public void setSelected(boolean isSelected)
        Called by other classes to tell this panel that it is selected.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Parameters:
        isSelected - If true, "Selected" will be displayed during Component.repaint(). Else no text is displayed.

      • setMouseHover

        public void setMouseHover(boolean hover)
        Called by other classes to let this panel know that a mouse is hovering over it.
        Complexity: O(N). Since the overwritten Component.repaint() is O(N).
        Parameters:
        hover - Sets __isHover to this value and runs Component.repaint(). The background color is repainted in different color based on the boolean value.

      • updateDeckIcon

        public void updateDeckIcon(int cardCount)
        Called by other classes every time there is an update the the ModelFlashCardDeck data so that this panel can Component.repaint() everything to visually represent the changes.
        Complexity: O(N). Since the overwritten Component.repaint() is O(N).
        Parameters:
        cardCount - The number to be displayed on the JPanel during Component.repaint() to indicate how many cards are in the current deck.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Component.repaint() the different components of the JPanel with corresponding booleans for displayed certain text, card counts, and colors of each cards.
        Complexity: O(N).
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • drawShape

        private void drawShape(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d,
                       java.awt.Color cardColor,
                       double startingWidth,
                       double startingHeight)
        Instructions for how to draw a single card with the given color and location.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Parameters:
        g2d - Graphics2D object linked to super for running Component.repaint().
        cardColor - Color of the card.
        startingWidth - Width position of the card in the JPanel.
        startingHeight - Height position of the card in the JPanel.

        Used when drawing strings on the panel to add an outline to the text for better visibility.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Parameters:
        g2d - Graphics2D object linked to super for repainting.
        font - The font of the String being drawn.
        text - The text of the String being drawn.
        width - The width position of the String on the JPanel.
        height - The height position of the String on the JPanel.

        private void drawOneCard(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d,
                         ModelFlashCardDeck copyDeck)
        Instructions on how to draw when deck has 1 card, can be used later on to adjust the locations.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Parameters:
        g2d - The Graphics2D object linked to super for Component.repaint().
        copyDeck - Copy of the deck that is being analyzed to determine the color and order it would be displayed on the JPanel.

      • drawManyCard

        private void drawManyCard(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d,
                          ModelFlashCardDeck copyDeck)
        Instructions on how to draw when deck has 6 or more cards, can be used later on to adjust the locations.
        Complexity: O(N) where N is the number of flash cards stored in the queue array.
        Parameters:
        g2d - The Graphics2D object linked to super for Component.repaint().
        copyDeck - Copy of the deck that is being analyzed to determine the color and order it would be displayed on the JPanel.

      • drawCardPlacementGenerator

        private void drawCardPlacementGenerator(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d,
                                        ModelFlashCardDeck copyDeck,
                                        int width,
                                        int height)
        Used by all the method to read in the given deck data and convert it to a graphical representation.
        Complexity: O(N).
        Parameters:
        g2d - The Graphics2D object linked to super for Component.repaint().
        copyDeck - Copy of the deck with all the cards to be analyzed for colors and order.
        width - The width of where the repainted card will be drawn on the JPanel.
        height - The height of where the repainted card will be drawn on the JPanel.

      • updateDeckStatusRepaint

        public void updateDeckStatusRepaint(ModelFlashCardDeck currentDeck,
                                    ModelFlashCard currentCard)
        Used by other classes to update the painting in this class to represent changes.
        Complexity: O(N).
        Parameters:
        currentDeck - The deck to copy from.
        currentCard - If there is also a card currently being viewed, add a copy of that card to the deck to be analyzed as well, otherwise this can be null.

      • recursiveReverseDeckCopy

        private void recursiveReverseDeckCopy(ModelFlashCardDeck currentDeck,
                                      ModelFlashCardDeck copyDeck)
        Recursive method to copy the deck in reverse. Called by updateDeckStatusRepaint(ModelFlashCardDeck, ModelFlashCard).
        Complexity: O(N).
        Parameters:
        currentDeck - Should be a new empty deck which will have cards enqueued into this.
        copyDeck - Copy of the deck that will have its cards dequeued and enqueued into currentDeck but in reverse order.
